Params: {3: 'A crimson spiral tower materializes and crumbles at the periphery of your sight, space fractures and then mends, while red light penetrates the dim sky.'}
{3: 'Countless familiar silhouettes struggle at the edge of time and space.'}
{3: 'She battles fiercely within the crevice, all for a sliver of hope.'}
{3: 'Jagged crystals scatter as blood-red mist permeates the air, their "projections" appearing on every refractive surface.'}
{3: 'You find yourself relentlessly chased by eerie shadows, your body slowly dissolving. You ascend this strange staircase, pushing onward until you reach the very top...'}
{3: 'Raise your head before the <phonetic=reality>mirror</phonetic>. Tell me—'}
{3: 'Gray Raven Commandant... Who are you, exactly?'}
{3: 'I am a ghost who drowned at the bottom of the sea.'}
{3: 'Something shatters deep within you, and your consciousness suddenly snaps into perfect clarity as if the murky M.I.N.D. is washed through by ice water.'}
{3: 'Pair after pair of hands grasp yours, dragging you free from those complex information whirlpools.'}
{3: 'With the aid of the Hetero Tower, you briefly attach your gaze to the Hetero-Creature known as Chaos.'}
{3: 'As far as the eye can see, "you" stand on an empty platform, white fog permeating the surroundings as a spiral staircase extends endlessly toward the heavens.'}
{3: "This place doesn't seem like a safe spot to linger."}
{3: "After a moment's hesitation, you return to the platform and drag along the unconscious agent. Regardless, he could serve as an aid in this tower."}
{3: "Even though he's grown suspicious of you, he's left with no other option."}
{2: '(Head toward the staircase)', 3: '200', 4: '(Head toward the platform edge)', 5: '195', 8: '2', 9: '2', 11: '1'}
{3: "At the platform's edge lies an abyss of nothingness."}
{3: 'Around the staircase, countless gates stand on platforms of varying sizes.'}
{3: "Where is this place exactly? You don't recall seeing an area like this when you were in the Hetero Tower..."}
{3: 'Just as you hesitate over which direction to take, or whether to call out to Ishmael, the path behind you suddenly begins to collapse.'}
{3: 'With no time to think, you drag the unconscious agent forward, throw open the nearest gate, and rush inside.'}
{3: 'In the whirl of movements, a familiar symbol catches your eye, etched on the gate. Vonnegut appears to be awakening, softly murmuring something...'}
{1: 'The Four-Winged White Raven spreads its wings.', 3: '60', 4: 'ffffffff'}
{3: 'The Four-Winged White Raven spreads its wings.'}
